page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: This 3 x 4km block lies 6km south of Canterbury, west of the A2 London to Dover trunk road, and is situated on the Downs, north of the Elham Valley. Under the Kent Structure Plan, it is part of an area designated as: North Downs Special Landscape Area; Area of Great Landscape Value, and Kent Downs Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. It is undulating in character with land rising and falling 100m (from 35 - 135m above sea level) producing a gentle rolling countryside with small valleys where the gradient is steeper. It contains the civil parishes of Bishopsbourne and Kingston and small sections of Barham and Bridge. The two main centres of population are the villages of Bishopsbourne and Kingston with small hamlets at Marley and Pett Bottom, and isolated farms scattered throughout the area.
